wikipedia_page.main: Alan Kay (born 2 August 1961) is a Scottish former footballer who played for Partick Thistle and Dumbarton.

response: Alan Kay is a computer scientist known for his work at the Xerox Palo Alto Research Center.
Alan Kay may also refer to:
* Alan Kay (judge), US magistrate judge in Washington DC
* Alan Kay, season 1 winner of the TV series Alone
* See Kaye effect for Alan Kaye, British engineer
* See WGTZ#Z-93 Morning Shows for Alan Kaye, American disk jockey
* The League match against East Fife on 14 November marked Alan Kay's 100th appearance for Dumbarton in all national competitions - the 95th Dumbarton player to reach this milestone.
